sourceDesc.p: No source: created in electronic format.

encodingDesc.p: Encoding according to the CCH TEI Guidelines

div.p: Confectionary, bakery, or delicatesssen, presumably in the third district (Landstraße) of Vienna, visited frequently by Schenker in the late 1920s.

There are many references to it in Schenker's diary; typical examples are: "At Fritz's, chocolate (8 shillings)" (March 26, 1926), "The bread fetched from Fritz's ‒ everything settled up" (Feb 22, 1926), and "After teatime, at Fritz's (nibbles for 11.40 shillings)" (April 11, 1927). Schenker even had items dispatched by Fritz to his summer residence in Galtür (Aug 15, 1928). The firm evidently also sold products for diabetics ‒ Schenker himself was diabetic ‒ for there is reference to purchase of a "Diät-Dessert" (July 11, 1928).

No firm identification of the shop can be made, but one possibility is Franz Fritz Delikatessen, at Beatrixgasse 3A, a street that intersects with the Reisnerstraße, about half a mile from Schenker's home in the Keilgasse.

listBibl.bibl: Adolph Lehmann's Allgemeiner Wohnungs-Anzeiger nebst Handels- und Gewerbe-Adreßbuch für die Bundeshauptstadt Wien [Vienna street directory]
